meanings.definition: A feeling of great surprise or wonder.
meanings.sent1: Her face showed astonishment when she saw the magician make the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent2: The children watched with astonishment as the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's astonishment at seeing a squirrel for the first time was priceless.
meanings.sent4: The sudden burst of colors in the sky filled everyone with astonishment.
meanings.sent5: The sheer size of the waterfall left us in complete astonishment.

meanings.definition: The state of being amazed or shocked.
meanings.sent1: His astonishment at winning the award was evident in his wide eyes.
meanings.sent2: The news of the unexpected victory brought astonishment to the entire team.
meanings.sent3: The cat's astonishment at the sight of a cucumber behind it was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The level of destruction caused by the storm left everyone in astonishment.
meanings.sent5: The sudden change in weather brought astonishment to the residents of the town.
